Name: King & Crown
Description: King & Crown is a modular microgame for 2-5 players. With only 5 cards per deck, King & Crown offers five different games utilizing the same cards, though some variants require each player to have their own deck of cards. From dueling to bluffing, to social deduction, there’s something in here for everyone. And with the small size and few components, it’s great to take along and play while you’re in line waiting for other things.

Name: Nine Worlds: Sagas and Treasures
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The battles to control the Nine Worlds take on a new dimension with the introduction of hidden objectives to fulfill. At the same time, in their efforts to conquer the Nine Worlds, the lords of each world turn to powerful artifacts and potent treasures to gain the advantage. Can you still conquer the Nine Worlds?

This expansion for Nine Worlds contains 30 cards:
12 Objective Cards, 12 Treasure Cards, 6 Victory Point Cards. (used in the games featuring Treasure Cards)

Players can decide if they wish to play with both Objectives and Treasures or just use one set for their game.

Players may use 1 or two Treasures in the game which each have an unique power they can use to give them the edge.

Objectives are hidden goals players can score bonus points for achieving.

Name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Tragic Events
Description:
Flash Point: Fire Rescue - Tragic Events is an expansion for Flash Point: Fire Rescue, a cooperative game for 1-6 players that plays in 45 minutes.

Tragic Events includes the Fire & Event decks that are designed to replace the Hot Spot mechanic in the Experienced game rules and add exciting new "events" to make each game of Flash Point even more unique. This expansion also includes three specialists, each with their own mini: Strategist, Suppression Specialist, and Fire Prevention Specialist.

Name: Pictopia: Marvel Cinematic Universe Edition
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Marvel fans assemble for the action-packed, picture-trivia card game 
Pictopia: Marvel Cinematic Universe Edition'. Test your knowledge of your favorite Marvel movies with two hundred questions! Answer trivia about Earth's Mightiest Heroes, the greatest Guardians of the Galaxy, and all Realms in between! Earn tokens for each correct answer! For a daring twist, risk what you've earned for the chance to win big!

Name: Bears vs Babies: Exclusive Backer Card
Description:
You are so marvelous.
If I could, I would give you 5 stars.
I would grind you up
into a paste.
I would put that paste on a hoagie
and take slow, thoughtful bites.
I would relish you
as a submarine sandwich.
Because you're great
and you backed our Kickstarter.
You made our game a reality.
Thank you
-Bears vs Babies

P.S. Inside this sleeve is your very own Exclusive Backer Card. You can use it in place of the Bear Heads in the game, or use it to add an extra player.

Name: Bye-Bye Black Sheep: 2017 Promo card
Description: This promotional card for Bye-Bye Black Sheep is a wild card that can be used to represent any set card.

Name: Dark Tales: The Solstice Faire
Description:
An exclusive setting card for Dark Tales.

During the Solstice Faire, a terrible scuffle broke out between the Villagers and the people of the castle because of an enchanted elixir. In order to preserve the reputation of the realm, the Margrave decides to investigate...

Released in Spielbox issue 2017/7.

Name: Viking Tourists
Description:
Erik the Red, leader of the vikings, has decided it's time to discover America — but the vikings are lazy and in no mood to go on a long holiday trip…

The players in Viking Tourists are tribal leaders who try to gather the young and the old of the village to go and see the world. Every player builds their own sequence of vikings and the opponents' sequences as well, but without helping each other, victory cannot be achieved.

Whoever first collects all fifteen members of the village, uses all four action cards (which can set back or help opponents), and has no more cards in hand wins the game and can set sail to America.

Name: Hadművelet
Description:
It must be very exciting to get across the Alps riding an elephant like Hannibal, to conquer the greater part of the world like Napoleon or to subdue Napoleon like Kutusov. Still in is more interesting to be able - like a mighty general - to command one's own modern army, to purchase arms, tanks, and soldiers and fight battles against the armed forces of an imaginary country. The game can be played by two or more players, more partners can overcome the enemy with allied forces led by mutual chosen commanders.

There are neither children nor adults who not be taken by a victory, that is due to their own skillful, cunning strategy and their clever quick decisions.

Name: Thunee
Description:
Tani, after the Tamil word for water, is a popular trick-taking card game that originated in Durban, South Africa. It was invented by Indian indentured-labourers who arrived in South Africa to work in the sugarcane fields.

The game is part of the Jack Nine card games family, which includes twenty-eight, and the much older card games of the Jass family.

Thunee is best for four players in fixed partnerships, sitting crosswise, but can also be played by 2 or 6 (2 teams of 3 players). It is played with 24 cards only. The Sixes, referred to as the "ball cards", are used to keep the scores. The highly original ranking of cards and the card-point values are as shown in the table. The first and foremost rule of the game is to always follow suit, if a player does not have that suit he may play any other card in his deck.

Name: Fantasy Defense: The Stone King
Description:
The Stone King is a campaign expansion to Fantasy Defense, adding new units, scenarios and rules that twist the battle in new directions. You can't just open the box and play with everything immediately; instead, the Stone King Campaign is divided into eight hidden chapters, each building on the last. Each chapter is printed with the unlock condition that must be met before players can open it.

Inside each chapter, you'll always find the same two types of cards: The story card reveals the world of Fantasy Defense, with notes and snippets that drive the narrative forward; the rules card introduces new mechanisms and concepts, so you can play with all the components you've just unlocked. However, Fantasy Defense isn't a legacy game! When it's all finished, you can return to the original version and play that. You could also put back all cards in their original envelope and start from the beginning — or you can spice things up, mixing and matching different elements as you wish.

The Stone King provides a more varied and challenging experience for those players who have figured out the basic gameplay of Fantasy Defense.

Name: Suricat' Cache
Description: A card-driven game about getting your meerkats to safety. Some cards will move one of your meerkats forward, other cards will cause the eagle to strike. If the eagle strikes when your meerkats  are on top of the mound, you have to be quick to get the meerkats to safety.

Name: Dream Home: 156 Sunny Street
Description:
With the Dream Home: 156 Sunny Street expansion, you can spice up your next game of Dream Home with more helpers, tools, décor, rooms, and two new ways to play! With the "Family and Friends" mode you can invite friends and relatives to stay over at your house, and with "Construction Plans" you score additional points by following specific construction requirements.

Dream Home: 156 Sunny Street includes components that allow you to play Dream Home with up to six players, while also including a solitaire version for when you're home alone.

Name: Deutscher Spielepreis 2017 Goodie Box
Description:
The Deutscher Spielepreis 2017 Goodie Box is a product to support the Deutscher Spielepreis, the second biggest German board game prize, for which thousands of players vote each year between May and July for their favorite game. This box contains a small expansion for four of the top ten games of the Deutscher Spielepreis 2017: A Feast for Odin, First Class, Great Western Trail, and Ice Cool, as well as a bonus expansion for Word Slam.

Contains:

     ICECOOL: Brian Gomez Promo
     A Feast for Odin: New Special Tiles
     First Class: Call for Tenders
     Great Western Trail: The Eleventh Building Tile
     Word Slam: DSP-Edition

Name: New York Slice: 2017 Specials
Description: New York Slice: 2017 Specials is a set of nine special promotional tiles for use with the New York Slice base game.

Name: Happy Hour!
Description:
From the makers of Dinner's Ready!, Happy Hour! is the first card game to help get you buzzed, challenging players to collect and deliver cocktails based on actual recipes! Not only is Happy Hour! fun and competitive, the more you play, the more familiar you'll become with cocktails!


    Drinking IS NOT a required element of playing the Happy Hour! card game, but we do have suggested drinking rules for full enjoyment!*


Happy Hour! is easy to set up and fun to play!

Happy Hour! is a game that fundamentally parallels the bartending experience of assembling mixed drink orders as quickly as possible.

Overview of gameplay: Players are dealt a hand of INGREDIENT CARDS, containing alcohols, mixers, and toppings.

INGREDIENT CARDS: There are four kinds of alcohol ingredients: vodka, whiskey, gin, and tequila!
There are a handful of MIXERS, including triple sec, sweet & sour, club soda, tonic water, ginger beer and vermouth!
The TOPPING cards consist of garnish (orange/lime/lemon/olive), cherry, and mint!
There are also ACTION CARDS which can help or hinder your drink-making progress, including spilled drinks, restock the bar, "scratch that," make it a double, and wild cards!

THE BAR: A row of ingredient cards available during each turn.
THE COUNTER: A row of recipe cards that must be fulfilled.

Using these cards in combination, players can create any one of the 21 drink RECIPE CARDS. Drinks range on a scale of 4-7 points, depending on quantity of ingredients required.

The first "bartender" to collect 21 points wins!

Happy Hour! is a fun card game for 2-4 adults, with rounds typically requiring 10-40 minutes.

Name: LazerKnight
Description:
LazerKnight is a solo chess variant with a razor sharp edge. You are the LazerKnight! Your whole regiment was slaughtered in a brutal ambush and you are the sole survivor. Sworn to avenge your dead comrades, you sneak through the enemies' territory to defeat them single-handedly. Or at least take as many of them with you as you can!

In this game you take on the role of a single knight chess piece which is going against a full set of opposing chess pieces. Your goal is to take out the enemy king and stay alive. To pull this off against all odds, you have the ability to hide out in black squares, gathering strategy tokens, which allow you to every once in a while break from your cover and strike out with multiple moves at once! But don't wait too long, because the enemy is not standing still and will try to encircle you, until its checkmate for you.

LazerKnight is a 1-page-rule ready to play solo chess game, specifically designed for the Boardgamegeek Solitaire Print and Play Contest. All you need to play is a chess board, chess pieces, 2 eight-sided dice and 5 tokens.

Name: Caution, Under Construction!
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Foreman Ben oversees a large construction site, making sure that all machines and vehicles are at the right place at the right time. But watch out! Sometimes Ben has to run to the men's room. Who is the fastest worker, carrying out the most tasks for Ben?

Caution, Under Construction! is a high-speed construction-site card game.

Name: Rally Run!
Description:
Everyone wants to hold the coveted DaCart Rally trophy — but the race track is tricky and constantly changing, so the drivers must try to remember the best route without getting trapped in a dead end! Who can steer their zooming racer as quickly as possible over the pit stop and across the right finish line?

Rally Run! is a tricky memory matching game.

—description from the back of the box

Name: Frostgrave: Ulterior Motives
Description:
The Frozen City harbours many secrets, and not all of them are ancient. While most adventurers who brave the dangers seek wealth and lost magic, some journey into Frostgrave for more personal reasons…

This expansion for Frostgrave consists of 40 Ulterior Motive cards, which add variety, depth, and new tactical challenges to wargames in the Frozen City. Each card presents the player with a specific task to accomplish and offers rewards if they succeed. Some of these missions must be revealed to all of the players, others must be kept secret. Will your wizard seek to slay a great demon? Rescue a desperate captive? Bring retribution to an enemy? All wizards seek power, but what are their ulterior motives?

Name: Robo Diner
Description:
"The test is about to begin. Gather the correct combination of food items as they move on the conveyor belt and deliver it to the organic test subjects. Execute the right subroutines to serve them what would keep their squishy meat components operating within their optimal parameters. The robot model that performs the best will be selected for mass production. Ensure that it is you."

Robo Diner is a fast-paced family card game featuring set collection and simultaneous action selection mechanics for 2-4 players ages 12 and up. Players start the game with a robot waiter character card that is placed in front of a specific section of the conveyor belt. When a round begins, players will secretly choose whether or not they will move the belt by one step.

Food items on the belt can be manipulated with the use of power cards. Players pick up the card that is located in front of their character in order to fulfill customer orders. At the end of the game, the winner is the player that has managed to please customers the most by grabbing the right cards from the belt, completing orders, and avoiding mistakes.

Name: Carcassonne: CutCassonne
Description:
10 cut-n-play tiles for Carcassonne in the new art style introduced in 2014 that apparently were hidden on the bottom of the gift box "Hans im Päckchen" given at out Essen 2014.

There are 10 tiles (that have to be cut out from a sheet) and no meeples (the players have to use some substitutes). If you glue them on blanc tiles, you could use it as an expansion.

Name: Come Together
Description:
Players explore what fetishes their partner might be into while trying to guess what they will actually be. The base set of Come Together has 142 cards with different sex acts/fetishes on them. Four cards are set out, then players secretly select which card they are most interested in. Then players guess which card their partner chose. Unchosen cards are discarded and replaced, and a secret selection happens again. If players match on the same card twice in a row, they win and probably want to try out whatever the winning match is.

The game is very much not for kids. But with values rooted in sex positive feminism and content that supports a wide variety of sexual interests and gender identities, the game is also very much not like most other "couples" games on the market.

Name: The Battle for Gotham City
Description:
Gotham City is plagued by its most famous villains: Joker, Riddler, Penguin, Mr Freeze, Killer Croc and Man bat. Each player takes on the role of Batman, in a race to defeat these villains and save the city.

Players roll dice and move around the board collecting tokens and fighting villains, in order to collect transport tokens. these are in the form of the Batmobile, Bat Boat, and Bat Cycle, each of which allows the player to advance to the next level of the board. The first player to defeat a villain on level 4 is the winner.

Name: Unfair: Gen Con Promo Card
Description:
Promo card.

     Available at Gen Con 2016.
     Available in the Unfair Kickstarter 2016.
     Available in the Unfair ABDW expansion Kickstarter 2018.
     Planned to be available in future crowdfunding campaigns.


Shuffle this card into the relevant deck(s) during setup and proceed as normal.
Add no more than one copy of any sneak peek or promo card.

Gen Con (Attraction - Sideshow)
Park limits do not apply to this attraction.
If this attraction ever closes, move it to the next park in turn order then reopen it.
Guests step: Gain 1 extra coin for each guest visiting your park.

There's epic loot to be had, if only you can sneak it past the dragon.

Name: Yokohama: Achievements & Free Agents Promo
Description:
Yokohama: Promo Tiles is a punch sheet of two unique promos for Yokohama.

Promo #1: Achievement Reward Tokens

Setup: Randomly choose 4 achievement reward tokens to place near the achievement cards. Return the rest to the box.

Rules: When completing all 3 achievements, collect one of the achievement rewards and keep it face up in front of you. You may count achievement reward flags toward obtaining foreign agents and scoring for country icons at the end of the game. You may use achievement reward free agents like any other foreign agent during your free action phase.

Promo #2: Free Agent 5-power Tokens

Setup: Mix these free agent tokens into the supply of 5-power tokens and setup the game as normal.

Rules: When you collect a free agent token, keep it face up in front of you. You may use it like any other foreign agent during your free action phase.

Name: Box Quiz: Travel
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Travel'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about travel. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

Name: Box Quiz: Love
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Love'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about love. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

Name: Super Genius: Multiplication 1
Description:
This is a collection of games teaching single-unit multiplication equations (from 2 to 5). The game contains 42 cards, half of which have 5 numbers (products) on them, the other half have 5 equations. One of the equations on an equations card will match one of the numbers on a number card.

In one of the games, players find the matching equation and number on a pair of cards (similar to Catch the Match). In other games, players find matches between two products, or two equations.

Name: Ice Dice
Description: Discover the secret life of Santa in Ice Dice! Practice basic arithmetic operations: roll the dice and use the values of the dice and either addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division to obtain a new number and move the corresponding token from one board to another. Collect the best combination of tokens on your player board to win!

Name: Not Alone: The Yellow Artefact Promo
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The Yellow Artefact promo cards are composed of 1 survival card, 1 hunt card and 4 new place (#10) cards.

The survival and the hunt cards may be added to their respective stack.

The new place card is a new version of the artefact and replaces the one of the base game.

Name: Spirit Island: Promo Pack 1
Description:
Two promo Spirits for Spirit Island, printed as part of the initial Kickstarter. Includes two Spirit Mats and eight Unique Power cards. When in print, it is available directly from Greater Than Games.

Heart of the Wildfire is a joyous Spirit of fire, destruction, and (maybe eventually) renewal. Mechanically, it's high-complexity, extreme-offense, and blights the land as it spreads.

Serpent Slumbering Beneath the Island is a slow-to-wake primal Spirit of the deep, deep earth. Mechanically, it's high-complexity and slow-developing with huge late-game payoffs.

Both spirits were released separately in Germany as: 

     Spirit Island: Seele des FlÃ¤chenbrands
     Spirit Island: Unter der Insel schlummernde Schlange

Name: Fantastiqa: The Soul-Soothing Spring of The Mystical Mina Promo Card
Description: Promo card for Kickstarter of Fantastiqa: Rival Realms.  Used with Fantastiqa. After setting up the game as usual, this card is placed next to the WETLANDS Region, and remains in play for the entire game.  Alternately, it may be placed next to any region.  Card allows players to spend 1 Gem to reclaim any card from their discard if they end their turn in this Region.

Name: Fantastiqa: Rift of the Rival Realms Promo Cards
Description:
This card is a new Artifact Card for use in Fantastiqa: Enchanted Edition and Fantastiqa: Rucksack Edition. It's included in all copies of Fantastiqa: Rival Realms -- four total, one per player of Fantastiqa. Players each begin the game with one copy of this Artifact.

RIFT OF THE RIVAL REALMS: On the turn when played, any subdued Creature Cards are not discarded. Instead, they are added to the player's hand and can be used immediately.

(This effect is very similar to the use of combos in Fantastiqa Rival Realms.)

Name: SUM Card Game
Description:
Description from the publisher:

SUM is a Maths based card game where your goal is to make equations using the cards in. Solve the most equations or get rid of all the cards in your hand to win.

SUM is a great game as well as a fun tool to help people improve their Math skills. The distribution of 1 to 9 numbers well as +, -, x and ÷ cards allow younger players to make simple equations while still staying competitive against those with a broader knowledge of Mathematics. While older players can try their hand at making more complex equations to get rid of more cards in their hand at one go.

And for those who want a stimulating party game to play with their friends, the Wild cards add an extra level of strategy to each game.

Name: À Descoberta da Madeira
Description:
Quiz game about the current and historic development of the Madeiran (Portugal) archipelago.

A dice is rolled to move the player's piece and they are required to correctly answer a question about various places on the islands, in order to conquer the current place on the board.

The winner is the one with the most conquered places on the isles of Madeira and Porto Santo.

All questions are in Portuguese and require quite some knowledge of local politicians, sports teams, companies, places, events, etc.

Name: Memo Dice
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Memo Dice demands the full attention of players right from the start because they must remember which die faces have been hidden underneath the colorful cups.

The game includes nine six-sided dice that show 54 images across their faces with the sides being colored black, blue, or red. The starting player for the round rolls a die, gives everyone a chance to memorize the topmost face, then covers it with a die cup that matches the color of the face. The next player then rolls a die, and so on. As soon as no die cup remains that matches the face of the current die, the current player covers this die with the gold die cup, ending the round.

This player then has the first chance to guess the first die in the line. If correct, the player scores 1 point, then guesses the next die; if wrong, the next player gets to guess. Whoever guesses the die under the gold die cup scores 2 points. Players play multiple rounds until someone reaches a total of 20 points, winning the game.

Name: Monster Destruction
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The Monster Destruction Deck Building game centres around earning reputation points from destroying buildings and accumulating Mutations, Enhancements and Minions. Starting the game with your basic monster card and some smash cards and exhausted monster cards you play them to gain new cards and abilities that will increase / build your deck. The game ends when you have destroyed all the cities and you then count up all your cards deck to see who has the most reputation points.

Name: Go Nuts for Donuts: Zombie
Description:
Go Nuts for Donuts: Zombie is a Kickstarter Limited Exclusive promo card for use with Go Nuts for Donuts.

This is a purple card for use with 4+ players. It grants 4 points and is discarded ("Discard this card.")

Name: Go Nuts for Donuts: Apple Fritter
Description:
Go Nuts for Donuts: Apple Fritter is a Kickstarter Limited Exclusive promo card for use with Go Nuts for Donuts.

This is a green card for use with 2+ players. It grants 3 points "if there are 13 or more cards in the discard pile."

Name: Tief im Riff
Description:
Description from the publisher:

In Tief im Riff ("Deep in the Reef"), players work cooperatively as fish swimming through a coral reef to turn over 28 sea animal tiles placed around the game board. The fish start in one location, then travel through a series of paths — following the arrows as they move — to reach openings in the reef.

On a player's turn, they roll a die, then choose one of the four fish and move it along paths a number of spaces equal to the number rolled. After they finish moving, if they're on a space all by themselves, they can reveal a tile that has only one bubble on it. If they share a space with other fish, they can reveal a tile with as many bubbles as the number of fish on that space. Thus, players need to keep their school from wandering too far apart as they travel through the reef.

If the players manage to reveal all 28 tiles before all four fish have swum out of the reef, then they win!

Name: Rock Paper Scissors Bomb
Description:
"A futuristic version of the quick-draw rock, paper, scissors game with four bomb cards"

The game contains 41 cards in a mix of rock, paper, scissor, and bomb cards.  Players divide then deck and reveal cards from their own decks one by one.  The winner claims both cards (with bombs always winning), and the player with most won cards after the decks are exhausted.  Ties are set aside and awarded to the winner of the next card-duel.  Essentially, the game is War with Rock-Paper-Scissors combat resolution.

Name: Heroes of Normandie: US Airborne
Description:
Content:


     1 mini punchboard
     6 french paratroopers Action cards
     6 english paratroopers Action cards
     2 dice with the US paratroopers colors
     14 wooden Order tokens with the US paratroopers colors


Use this expansion to personalise your army with new Order tokens and dice. Customise your deck with new Action cards to power up your army.

You must have the Heroes of Normandie base game and the Sainte-Mère-Eglise scenario pack in order to use this expansion pack.
Families: Series: Heroes System Tactical Scale World War 2

Name: Heroes of Normandie: GE Airborne
Description:
Contents:

• 1 mini punchboard
• 6 french paratroopers Action cards
• 6 english paratroopers Action cards
• 2 dice with the german paratroopers colors
• 14 wooden Order tokens with the german paratroopers colors

Use this expansion to personalise your army with new Order tokens and dice. Customise your deck with this new Action cards to power up your army.

You must have the Heroes of Normandie base game and the Carentan scenario pack in order to use this expansion pack.
Families: Series: Heroes System Tactical Scale World War 2

Name: Heroes of Normandie: UK Airborne
Description:
Contents:

• 1 mini punchboard
• 6 french paratroopers Action cards
• 6 english paratroopers Action cards
• 2 dice with the Commonwealth paratroopers colors
• 14 wooden Order tokens with the Commonwealth paratroopers colors

Use this expansion to personalise your army with new Order tokens and dice. Customise your deck with this new Action cards to power up your army.

You must have the Heroes of Normandie base game, the Commonwealth Army box and the Pegasus Bridge scenario pack in order to use this expansion pack.
Families: Series: Heroes System Tactical Scale World War 2

Name: Heroes of Normandie: Radar Station and Factory
Description: Two punchboards with extra terrain and buildings.
Families: Series: Heroes System Tactical Scale World War 2

Name: Dominion: Nocturne
Description:
Game description from the publisher:

You've always been a night person; lately you've even considered becoming a vampire. There are a lot of advantages: you don't age; you don't have to see yourself in mirrors anymore; if someone asks you to do something, you can just turn into a bat, and then say, sorry, I'm a bat. There are probably some downsides though. You always think of the statue in the town square that came to life and now works as the tavern barmaid. The pedestal came to life too, so she has to hop around. The village blacksmith turns into a wolf whenever there's a full moon; when there's a crescent moon, he turns into a chihuahua. That's how this stuff goes sometimes. Still, when you breathe in the night air, you feel ready for anything.

Dominion: Nocturne, the 11th expansion to Dominion, has 500 cards, with 33 new Kingdom cards. There are Night cards, which are played after the Buy phase; Heirlooms that replace starting Coppers; Fate and Doom cards that give out Boons and Hexes; and a variety of extra cards that other cards can provide.

Dominion: Nocturne is a part of the Dominion series.

Name: Guild Ball: The Blacksmith's Guild – Forged From Steel
Description: Guild Ball: The Blacksmith's Guild – Forged From Steel is an expansion for Guild Ball.

Name: Stack3D
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Stacked is a trick taking dexterity game for 2-5 players that mixes the dexterity and simplicity of tower stacking (like a Jenga), with Tetris like shapes and a simple trick taking mechanic.

The game is played to a number of points or rounds decided by the players (typically 2 rounds or 50 points).

The oldest player calls a trick type (color or if playing with color blind, symbol) and then counts down, 3, 2, 1 FLIP! The player who reveals the highest card wins that trick, takes the lead (so they may start the next turn) AND gets to give their shape to another player who must stack it on the tower for them!

There are two of every number in the deck, so watch out for ties! Both players play their own piece and nobody wins the trick. Fun for all ages with parental supervison.

Name: Forgotten Lands
Description:
Description from the designer:

Can you re-discover the Forgotten Lands? Evidence has surfaced of a civilization lost to time. Historical clues have led your archaeological team to the general area where they existed, but now you must find the exact location of their sacred sites and buildings. You're not the only one looking however so you'll need to hurry if you want to claim the discovery for yourself.

In this solo roll and write game, you'll enter numbers into the search areas for four lost sacred sites/buildings. You're goal is to match the total for each row and column to a target number. The better that you're able to do this, the quicker your team can locate the site and the higher you'll score. Take too long and a rival archaeological team will find it first and you'll get no points.

As you search for the first three sacred sites: the Altar of Offerings, the Observatory, and the Grand Temple, you'll find clues leading you to the general location of a fourth huge site known as the Tomb of Kings. You'll use those clues to unlock that location and then search for it as well. The Tomb of Kings has the potential to earn you the most points, but is also the most difficult.

Name: Super Voxel Raiders
Description:
Description from the publisher (English):
In the world of Pixelia, Voxels are the key to an unknown dimension. The struggle for the control of these artifacts started with a war across the three main nations: the Redistan Rally, the Greenland Gathering, and the Bluelonia Brotherhood. Soon it escalated into a fratricidal war where loyalties lost their meaning.

Super Voxel Raiders is a cardgame that reproduces japanese role playing videogame battles (JRPGs) from the 90s. Players first recruit pixellated characters into three different territories, then a battle is fought in each of those territories, using plenty of fancy special powers. The first player to conquer two territories will gain control over the Voxels and win the game.

Description from the publisher (Spanish):
En el mundo de Pixelia, los Voxels son capaces de abrir la puerta a una dimensión desconocida. La pugna por el control de estos artefactos comenzó con una guerra entre las tres principales naciones: la República de Rojistán, el Virreinato de Verderia y la Alianza de Azulonia. Pronto desembocó en una lucha fratricida que no respeta lealtades.

Super Voxel Raiders es un juego de cartas que recrea batallas de videojuegos de rol japoneses (JRPG) de los años 90. Los jugadores se dedican a reclutar personajes pixelados en tres territorios distintos, para luego resolver en cada territorio una batalla llena de poderes especiales. El primer jugador en conquistar dos Territorios se hará con el control de los Voxels y será declarado ganador.

Name: The Terminator: System Upgrade
Description:
Available during The Terminator Kickstarter campaign, this expansion consists of:

12 Gear cards for 1984
6 Skynet 2029 upgrade cards
6 Resistance 2029 upgrade cards
2 New missions + Rule insert
1 Skynet Mainframe model

Name: The Terminator: Dogs of War
Description:
Available during The Terminator Kickstarter campaign, this expansion consists of:

4 Dog miniatures
2 New Stat Cards (1984, 2029)
2 New Mission cards + Rules insert

Name: The Terminator: Enemy of My Enemy
Description:
Available during The Terminator Kickstarter campaign, this expansion consists of:

20 Character cards + Rules insert
1 Double-sided Stat card
1 Mini

Name: The Terminator: Tunnel Vision
Description:
Available during The Terminator Kickstarter campaign, this expansion consists of:

8 Resistance action cards
4 Skynet action cards
1 Punchboad of Sewer & Travel tokens

Name: The Terminator: Road Rage
Description:
Available during The Terminator Kickstarter campaign, this expansion consists of:

4 Key Location tiles
4 Key Location cards
4 New Mission cards + Rules insert
3 Freeway tiles
2 New Vehicle minis

Name: NYX
Description:
NYX is a highly portable asymmetric card-lapping game for two players or for four players.  With four players, NYX plays as two partnerships.

In NYX, you assume role of an immortal Scion locked in an eternal struggle to influence mortal thoughts.  Take the side of Morpheus, God of Dreams and bearer of prophetic visions.  Or take the side of Morpheus’ menacing brother, Phobia, bringer of phantasms and nightmares.  Use your powers of prophetic dreams, nightmarish phantasms, powerful rifts, and enchanted cloaks in a clash for control of the ancient realm known as the Dream Plain.

The goal of NYX is to gain the most Victory Points.  You earn Victory Points by composing Divinations to collect Poppies and by building connected territories on the Dream Plain of either Nightmare or Prophecy.  Final scoring is based on the amount of area controlled and the number of Poppies cached.

The game of NYX is inspired by the legend Morpheus and Phobia.  They are brothers and scions of ancient gods:
Their father is Hypnos, the gentle, black-winged God of Sleep; twin to the Lord of Death; and ‘balm to the mortal soul.’  Their mother is Nyx, the frighteningly fierce and powerful primordial Goddess of Night borne of original Chaos, her overwhelming might revered and feared by all other gods...even Zeus himself.
  
The sons of Nyx and Hypnos dwell within an immense cavern buried in the deepest chasm of the Underworld.  Each night, Phobia, always envious of Morpheus’ renown, wages a great war with his formidable brother.  Since the beginning of time, while mortal men slumber, the two scions have been locked in an eternal struggle vying for absolute control of mortal visions and dreams.  At sundown, the two race from the depths of the Underworld as a cyclone rising like a smokey mist of bats. The two brothers hurtle towards their battle and their destiny on the Dream Plain.

Name: Beasts of Balance: The Ghost Crab
Description: This rare Artefact will mix up your game with its mysterious and unique powers. When you play it, The Ghost Crab will manifest in your world as one of the beasts you’ve unlocked in your Bestiary, introducing new strategy and helping you populate your world with extra fabulousness!

Name: Friegur: Das Kriegsspiel um Festung und Fahne
Description:
This game was published in commemoration of the 20th anniversary of the beginning of World War I. The title "Friegur" stands for: "Feldgraue rangen in Ehren, gewannen unsterblichen Ruhm"

Exerpt of the description by Elfriede Strey, as suplied at June 9, 1934 to the US patent Office: My invention relates to a game to be played on a board like chess by two persons or two parties and in which the aim is for one party to beat the other, under observation of determined rules.

Whereas in chess the various chessmen are moved merely according to their nature, the board of my new game has aspecial division or characterization of the squares which prescribes that determined menmust move only on determined squares.

According to the leading idea of my new game the board represents a terrain which comprises a fortress for each party, a glacis surrounding each fortress, and a battle ground situatedbetween the positions of the two parties. Both in the battle ground and in the glacises there are obstacles of various kinds which are denoted by differently marked squares. These obstacles further determine the moves of the various men, beyond their motion prescribed by their own nature. The rules of my new game, which may represent for example a battle for fortress and flag, further prescribe that the men or fighters may be both promoted and degraded, so that, for example, the 
 private soldier may be promoted to oflicer, if certain conditions are fulfilled, whilst an officer who has been derelict, may be degraded. Finally, as in chess, my new game provides that the fighters of one party may be taken according to determined rules, in order to break the fighting power of the enemy gradually.

Name: Assumptions: XXXpansion
Description: An adult add-on to Assumptions that contains 15 new characters and 40 new assumptions. Illustrated by Brooklyn artist Louie Chin this limited run (500 copies) was also manufactured in the US.

Name: Cutlass
Description:
Description from the designer:

Cutlass Deck building Cardgame is a Piratey, Cthulean-esque Character driven deckbuilder that uses expansive decision trees to garner incremental advantages over your opponent. With a vast array of options of amassing victory points, whether be chipping away at your opponents health, or push your luck economic growth, players aim to build enough wealth so that they can retire as wealthy pirates.
Cutlass hopes to incorporate vivid story-telling, and luscious art direction to immerse players in a in-depth world of pirates, monsters, gods, and conflict.

Name: Touched On
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Touched On is a tabletop party game of accidental fare evasion and undercover inspectors, based on Melbourne’s public transport network.

In Touched On, two or more players set off on their journey with the aim of getting rid of all their cards, collecting the most Exp, all while catching out their friends and arriving relatively fine-free.

Each player is dealt fare evaders who are a fun collection of characters inspired by our fellow commuters. Players are also dealt inspectors who come in two different forms. Authorised inspectors are easier to spot but will still slap you with a hefty fine. Then there's undercover inspectors -They're the ones you need to keep an eye out for as they'll pop up in the most unlikely of places.

Things can get out of hand when power cards come into play which are randomly drawn throughout the game. They'll give you abilities like switching the game to any lane or protecting yourself from the next player's move. How far can you push your luck? Can you spot the undercover inspector among the crowd? Can you ride the tram to safety? You never know what's around that tram track, Ben, so make sure you've touched on.

Name: Valeria: Card Kingdoms – Promo Pack
Description:
A three-card promo pack that was distributed in Game Trade Magazine #210 (August 2017).

The three promo cards are all Domain cards.

Coliseum (2 Soldiers, 1 shadow | 15 gold, 5 victory points): Immediately gain [strength] x [citizen] you own.

Ullamalizatli Court (2 workers, 1 holy | 11 gold, 3 victory points): Immediately gain [magic] x [citizen] you own.

Jousting Field (1 soldier, 1 worker, 1 shadow | 13 gold, 3 victory points): During your Harvest Phase, gain [1 gold] x Knight you own.

Name: Blinded by Science Trivia Game
Description: Players answer science-based trivia questions for points.  Once a predetermined number of cards have been read, highest score wins.

Name: Rollosseum
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Rollosseum is a dice battling game where players attempt to defeat their opponent(s) in an arena of fighters.  Each player takes on the roll of a character/fighter with special abilities, and completes attacks with the roll of the dice provided.  With various attacks at your disposal, easy to complete attacks wil do little damage to your opponent, while more difficult attacks will really cut your opponent's HP down.  Normal attacks can be made with the dice, and doing so will eventually allow you to use your special abilities to give yourself and edge and finally defeat your opponent(s).

One player wins when the others have fallen, bringing their HP down to (or below) zero.  Various modes of gameplay available, adding to the replay value and versatility of the game.

Name: Warfare: A New Game
Description:
Very little has been found about this game. Looks to be produced around 1900.  The picture on the cover shows British Colonial troops on the attack but they could be in South Africa, Afghanistan, or some other part of the empire.

The map leads me to believe the game is a representation of the Boer War.  It has two different sides, one of which appears to contain a British camp.  The other side has a town that appears to be more European and trenches manned by combatants that look to be Boer.

Name: Teotihuacãzinho
Description:
Description from the designer:

In Teotihuacãzinho, each player is an architect making a small Pyramid to become the Master Builder and erect the Pyramid of the Moon in Teotihuacã. The game lasts until any player completes his Pyramid or at the end of the 14th round. During a round, eight dice are rolled and every player selects three dice to use each one as an Action or as a Block. The Action varies with the color of the die: green dice are used to push blocks and move the workers, yellow dice are used to gain gold, blue dice are used to acquire objectives and gray dice are used to make buildings.

Name: Wing Leader: Victories C3i #29 Scenarios
Description:
Two scenarios and 30 counters for Wing Leader: Victories 1940-1942, included in C3i Magazine, Issue #29.

Scenario 1 - Cry Havoc, Tunisia, 21 March 1943.

Description: As Patton's II Corps began to push out of the passes through the Atlas mountains and descend on the Axis flanks, low-level raids were launched against Mezzouna and motor transport columns behind enemy lines, II/JG 51 was the spine of the air defence, but also had the task of covering close air support attacks on the American spearheads.

Fierce fights began to break out near Maknassy, with American raids colliding with German Raids travelling in the opposite direction.

Scenario 2 - Supercharge, Egypt, 4 November 1942.

Description: The second day of Operation Supercharge saw a general breaktrough on the ground. 51st Division and 4th Indian Division cleared the anti-tank screen, allowing 1st Armoured Division to get through. Abandoning the Italian divisions in the South, Rommel ordered a withdrawal to Fuka. Throughout the day the Western Desert Air Force mantained a continual bombardment and strafing of the mass of vehicles retreating along the coast road. The hairpins climbing the scarpment at Fuka and Mersa Matruh proved a deathtrap for the Axis. German and Italian fighters were thrown in to stem the tide of Allied bombing. Small clashes developed all over the sky.

Name: Birds of Prey: Airbattle RAG 1
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Airbattle RAG is the journal of Air Combat in the Jet Age, expanding Birds of Prey with articles, scenarios and play components. Delve into dogfighting tactics. Fly a new jet and wield a new missile. Look ahead to the next generation mechanics. Take your seat in a new scenario, using box-miniatures show off new markings, as well as new aircraft and missiles types!. Airbattle RAG 1 is for everyone who enjoys Birds of Prey! Airbattle RAG 1 contains the following content.

Birds of Prey Second Edition Preview Rules planned for the next edition of Birds of Prey are ready for play-test and first flown at the BoPGUN “Fox Three” event. Allows faster sighting! Streamlines gun combat! All ADCs enclosed are in preliminary second edition format. Conversion notes are included for first edition ADCs. â€¨Enclosed quick-reference card speeds play with the new rules. Fly a Cobra with new super-maneuverability rules. Fight with cutting-edge fighters and missiles. 

Cardboard Weapons School content include the Bearing Rate of Change tactics, allowing you to better anticipate your opponent and select your own maneuver with an innovative PHAD-based mechanism.

BoPGUN “Fox Three” Convention Materials Includes all the scenarios, aircraft and missiles played in the 2013 Birds of Prey Convention!
Families: Game: Birds of Prey (Ad Astra Games)

Name: Birds of Prey: Airbattle RAG 2
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Airbattle RAG 2 is an exciting expansion to the high-speed, high-gee world of Birds of Prey! The planes and scenarios of Tigershark Meet! are featured, including the spotlighted F-20 Tigershark. Sixteen new aircraft data cards are included, with the Dassault Rafale and Boeing Super Hornet exploring the UltraModern arena. Two new SOAR (Simulated Opponent Automation Rules) opponents are included, as well as the SOAR-30 rules, taking the SOAR capability into the vertical! There is a rich cross-section of missiles from both Chinas, and an unprecedented look inside the Tigershark Meet’s Cardboard Fighter Weapons School lessons on the OCA (Offensive Counter-Air) and DCA (Defensive Counter-Air) fight.
Families: Game: Birds of Prey (Ad Astra Games)

Name: Birds of Prey: Airbattle RAG 3
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Airbattle RAG 3 contains all the scenarios, lessons, aircraft and missiles from the Wings of the West convention. Combatants spanning over sixty years of combat aircraft development and all from Western nations gave the event its name. Airbattle RAG 3 also includes exclusive map components created for the cover scenario!

The Wings of the West event featured a truly exceptional Cardboard Fighter Weapons School session, with Sierra Hotel pilot Killjoy sharing his secrets of successful dogfighting. This lesson has been captured in these pages, so now you can learn the master’s secrets and continue your journey towards aerial dominance!

Wiseguy takes us on a personal journey through history of the air gaming community during the Origins years, liberally spiced by the tales of his now legendary convention T-shirts.

Our coverage of target aircraft continues, with new scenarios and further rules for bomber-type aircraft.
Families: Game: Birds of Prey (Ad Astra Games)

Name: Shipwrecked
Description:
Description from the publisher:

You and the other players are castaways on an uncharted island. A gang of motley monkeys has stripped all your shipwrecks of vital parts. The goal of the game is simple: collect the plunder and monkeys that you’ll need to repair your ship and sail home. In order to get those items, you’ll need you’ll need to outbid and outsmart the other castaways in auctions run by Captain Coconuts, the wily monkey leader who controls the island — and your fate.

Shipwrecked is a classic auction game with a twist: Instead of bidding with your bananas, you’ll have a hand of six tokens that you’ll use to make your bid in a series of secret auctions. Each token interacts with those placed by the other players - but no one knows who has played what until the bids are revealed. Once a round of the auction round is won, the other players can spend their bananas (cash) in order to push the auction to the next level. If they do, more plunder and monkey cards are added, and the auction continues!

During every round, the cost of winning increases by one banana, as does the cost of pushing the auction forward. Your bid tokens all have unique effects, but once they’ve been played in an auction they stay on the board. That means you’ll want to save your most powerful bid tokens for the moment when they count the most.

It’s easy to learn, but the more you play, the more you’ll discover the layers of depth and strategy in the bid and push gameplay. The order that you use your tokens not only determines the outcome of the current auction round but your ability to effectively bid in upcoming rounds as well. Winning auctions will give you the plunder and monkeys you need to win, but you’ll be tempted to trade in your hard-won booty for short term gain: plunder cards can be traded in for extra bananas, while the monkey cards have special powers that can shift the outcome of the auctions — and the game!

Name: Take The Kingdom
Description:
"A blast - Take The Kingdom combines the weight of epic medieval fantasy with a speed rarely seen in the genre." - Blogcritics.org

A medieval-themed card game for 2, 3 or 4 players. Build your Kingdom, damage everyone else's: The winner is the last Kingdom standing - or the strongest one at the end of the game (when all cards have been played).

Each player starts with a Fort and some Land, which they can fortify with Walls, Moats, Battlements, Hills, Archers, Knights and Traps. Using the cards in the deck, you then defend your Kingdom, attack the defences of other Kingdoms with weapons, and aim to control the fate of your opponents with Earthquakes, Sabotage, Mutiny, Spies and more. Mercy cards also allow a lifeline for each player. 20-30 minutes to play.

Relaunching on Kickstarter in March 2021, and available to play now on Tabletop Simulator.

Name: Lipless!
Description:
Game summary:

Millions have watched the famous videos. Now you too can have fun making your friends and family look ridiculous saying the simplest phrases!

Wearing a mouth opener, you must get your teammate to understand phrases without using your lips!

Name: Whatcha Say
Description:
User summary:

Another party game with dental mouth openers.

Teams of players, hampered by lip retractors, attempt to read and interpret phrases. If your teammates guess the phrase you get the card as a point.

Team with the most points wins.

Name: Lipless: Expansion Pack #1
Description:
User summary:

200 all-new phrases for the base game.

Players wearing a mouth opener, must get your teammate to understand phrases without using your lips! to score a card. 
Team with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Name: Evy against Everything and Everyone Everywhere
Description:
This is the story of Evy, a young girl awaken from a slumber to find her nightmare monsters come to life.

In this single player scary-story adventure book-game, you’ll step in the shoes of Evy and help her out-run, out-smart and out-fight an unending stream of monsters.

You’ll rescue your family, your friends and basically be an all-round hero to everybody else.

Evy against Everything and Everyone, Everywhere is a book containing a single story, a tutorial on how to play the role of Evy and game rules to help you beat a dozen full-page adventures.

This game requires a number of components. You’ll find a list of easily attainable components inside the book. You also need to print a few pages of cards and cut them out. You can download these cards, the latest version of this book, both available in full-color and low-ink versions. There’s even blank maps and tips to help you make your own maps.

Name: Weltraumflug
Description: Each player has 4 pawns (cosmonauts). They have to get to a planet and back to earth again. To determine the destination planets, each player draws 4 cards. Then the players turn the spinner. If the spinner shows the angular coordinates of a destination planet, the player places a cosmonaut on the planet. When a player has all 4 cosmonauts on a planet, he begins to bring then back home, by spinning the angular coordinates of the planet they're on. The first player to get all 4 cosmonauts back to earth wins the game.

Name: Dwarf Slayer
Description:
You are a Dwarf. A stout, short fellow who has incredible skills with his hands. Dwarves live in caves, mining the hearth for minerals and gems, working them as smiths and jewelers and other sorts of craftsmen.

And, of course, all Dwarves love booze!

Each night, you frequent the local inn for a stiff drink. What you seek is the "Dwarf Slayer": an exquisite liquor, yet too much of it and you will remember naught of the past night when cometh next morn.

Each night, the inn hosts a "Tournament of Drunkards," with the patron to hold his liquor the best, collecting all the wagers. The Dwarf who has fallen into a humiliating slumber must pay for everyone's drinks; for, of course, he cannot remember if he agreed to do so. So who shall be the Champion Drunkard tonight?

Name: Speak Out: Joe Santagato Edition
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Pop a plastic mouthpiece in, say a phrase appearing on one of the game cards, and get your teammates to understand the phrase. Easy, right? No way! In this special edition of the popular SPEAK OUT game, with content written by Joe Santagato, the challenge is to speak clearly even though your mouth is just not working right! It's maddeningly fun to play, and absolutely hilarious to watch! For adults.

Name: Durch Sparen voran!
Description: This is a simple roll-and-move game. On some spaces events benefit or hinder the players. The first player to reach space 100 wins the game.

Name: Hidden Compartment Pack: Expansion for Cards Against Humanity and Exploding Kittens
Description:
The Hidden Compartment Pack is a Target-exclusive expansion for both Cards Against Humanity and Exploding Kittens.It is so named because the only way to get it was to flush it out of a hidden compartment of the big box stands.

Cards Against Humanity
The pack contains 14 white cards. None are blank cards. No black cards are included.

Exploding Kittens
Instruction for the 'Blind As A Bat' card, and 5 'Blind As A Bat' cards are included. The 'Blind As A Bat' card content is identical, the card backs are different for use with different versions of Exploding Kittens.
- 3 copies of the 'Blind As A Bat' card are included for use with the Exploding Kittens Party Pack (1st and 2nd edition). They also work with foreign language editions of the original game using this cardback.
- 2 copies of the 'Blind As A Bat' card are included for use with the original Exploding Kittens game (regular and NSFW). They also work with up to medium-sized games of the Party Pack's English 3rd edition.

From the product packaging:
"Whoa! Way to go, champ! You found our hidden pack. This pack contains new cards for both Cards Against Humanity and Exploding Kittens. The Exploding Kittens cards introduce a whole new mechanic to the game. The Cards Against Humanity cards serve absolutely no purpose."

Name: Sobrevivência na Amazônia
Description:
Explorers parachutes into the Amazonia Forest with a mission. They have to explore the forest while moving towards the rescue point inside the jungle. On their way they have to collect food, water and others resources to survive.
Every four rounds day turns into night and all players have to mount camp. Each movement is made based on a choice from three directions - forwards, left or right - that will lead into different areas of the jungle. The options are represented by event cards (that can be either river or forest). 
Full moon nights trigger magical happenings in the forest that are revealed by special cards dealt individually to each player.
On the way you can photograph animals at risk of extinction and expose situations that harm the forest life. These forest-aiding actions give extra bonuses. 
The first player to arrive at the rescue point receives extra bonus points and declares the last round of the game. The game winner is the player who helped the forest the most and survived well, gathering victory points in resources collected and good actions made.

Name: Scippio
Description:
Scippio is a filler cardgame for 4 players, set in the Punic Wars, around 200 B.C. Two players take command of the Roman Army as Publius and Fabian roman consuls, while the other two players will be Hannibal and Hasdrubal, carthaginian generals.

The main mechanics of the game are set collection and bluffing. Both players strive to collect a set of three equal cards, and then pass a secret signal to its partner. If the signal is sucessfully transmitted and understood, the allied general may attack and win the battle, but if it is intercepted by the enemy duo, it may leave the army vulnerable to a counter-attack.

The game lasts about 15-30 minutes per playthrough and is intented for ages 10+. The game has no language dependency, but its rulebook is written in Brazilian Portuguese.

Name: Red Horde 1920
Description:
In 1919, the governments of the victorious Allied powers met in Paris to discuss the post-war order of things. But while they were talking, history continued to move. As the rest of Russia descended into civil war, forces of the Red Army moved westward to exploit the power vacuum left by the retreating German armies. They were met by units of the new Polish Army, who pushed them back steadily into what is now Belarus. After the Polish overextended their forces in an offensive to take Kiev in early 1920, the greatly reinforced Red Army went over to the attack.

General Mikhail Tukhachevsky’s Order of the Day for July 2, 1920 read in part "To the West! Over the corpse of White Poland lies the road to worldwide conflagration. March on Vilno, Minsk, Warsaw!” As the new nation of Poland fought for its life and the front lines surged back and forth, both sides grew increasingly desperate. The war climaxed in the Battle of Warsaw in mid-August, as the Poles finally broke the Red Army and flung it back into Russia in disorder – to this day they refer to it as “the Miracle on the Vistula”.

Red Horde 1920 is an operational-level game on the action during this fateful summer. The Red Army smashes forward in the name of the Revolution, with masses of rifle divisions and the savage 1st Cavalry Army, commanded by Semyon Budyonny and filled with fierce Cossacks. The Poles resist with units of the Polish Legion, veterans of the fighting in France, and their national army. Ukrainians, Lithuanians, Hungarians and even a unit of Red Polish renegades swirl in and out of the chaos too.

Designer Brian Train has substantially revised and streamlined his original 2008 design of the same name, incorporating a newly-researched and more accurate order of battle with revised counter values, updated rules and a drastically revised map with a different scale.

Saddle up, comrades! Glory waits down the road!

Includes:

176 counters, showing Polish, Soviet and foreign volunteer forces at brigade to division scale. 
1 22x17-inch map of eastern Poland and western Byelorussia, ground scale 20 miles per hex. 
1 Full-color Rulebook, typeset for easy squinting. 
2 Player Aid Cards to stare at while the other guy hogs the rulebook. 
An anachronistic Ziploc bag to keep the counters in one cat-proof location.

You’ll also need to provide two six-sided dice for the Cause.

Name: BOMB SQUAD
Description:
Bomb Squad - ãƒœãƒ ã‚¹ã‚¯ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ‰ is a co-operative card game for two players.  Each player has a rack of five cards.  The cards have information on both sides.  The back side, which is only visible to the player, shows an X or O.  The front side, which is visible only to the other player, shows a number between one and five in one of five colors.  The goal of the game is to complete a grid of 25 cards - one of each number in each color - without using more than three cards that show an X on the back.

On your turn, your options are (1) spend a clue token to give your partner a hint; (2) play a card from your rack; or (3) discard a card from your partner's rack.  Whenever you play a card or have one of your cards discarded by your partner, you must draw a new card to replace it.

Play continues until (1) the deck runs out (at which time each player gets one final turn); (2) someone tries to play an unplayable card (thereby losing the game); or (3) the players complete their grid of 25 cards.

Name: The Big Push: Trench Warfare on the Western Front in World War One
Description:
Description from the publisher:

The year 1914 passed. France survived the Schlieffen Plan with the Miracle on the Marne and the Race to the Sea ended in a stalemate. Unable to outflank its opponent, each side entrenched. A new type of warfare began that would claim the lives of many millions: trench warfare!

Designed by Renaud Verlaque, winner of the 2003 Charles S. Roberts award for best Pre WW2 game with Age of Napoleon (Phalanx Games, 2003, and Mayfair Games) and designer of The Price of Freedom: the American Civil War 1861-65 (Compass Games, 2008), The Big Push is a card wargame on Trench Warfare on the Western Front in World War One. One player commands the armies of the Entente and the other the armies of the German Reich (a.k.a., Germany).

The game plays in a maximum of five annual turns, from 1915 through 1919. In each turn, the players are given an opportunity to innovate weapons and tactics, secretly deploy armies to the six sectors of the front line (from Flanders in the north to Verdun in the south), try to gain air superiority in order to reconnoiter the enemy before deciding whether to attack or defend, and then fight to gain the upper hand sector by sector and satisfy political pressure at home to attack and win. Meanwhile the Entente player hopes to reduce the German war effort through the naval blockade while the German player hopes to do the same through U-Boote Warfare, but at the risk of bringing the United States into the war on the side of the Entente. The German player must also contend with the demands of the Eastern Front on his war effort, at least until Russia sues for peace. Victory points are awarded for successful attacks, with each additional successful attack in the same turn resulting in a larger number of victory points than its predecessor as it increases the likelihood of immediate and decisive victory in the war. If neither player has gained enough victory points by the end of the 1919 turn to achieve victory, attritional victory is awarded to the player who accumulated the most victory points throughout the game (but a tie means a draw).

Name: That Snow Moon: Know This Integration
Description:
Bounty hunters, smugglers, crime lords, and other opportunists join the fray, getting involved in galactic affairs to line their own pockets.  You will never find a more wretched hive than that of villain and scummy.

Contains:
6 Bounty Hunter Contacts

Adds:
A fifth player to That Snow Moon

Name: Circle the Wagons: Lone Cowboy
Description:
Think there ain't much on these here plains that you haven't seen, heard, or shot at? Put your skills to the test in the solo version of Circle The Wagons.

Contains:

     6 scenario cards.



Put your skills to the test against a wily opponent in the solo expansion for Circle the Wagons.

Lone Cowboy is a series of solo expansions for Circle the Wagons and Second Shot. Each set introduces new scenario cards. These tell the player which scoring conditions to use in the game as well as adding specific rules to determine the behavior of the non-human opponent. The solo game is played over two rounds but otherwise follows standard gameplay.

To setup a game using any of the Lone Cowboy sets, choose 1 scenario card and place it in the center. Find the two scoring conditions listed on the scenario and add them to the center.

Deal out 8 cards in a circle. The player drafts and places cards on their turn as normal, with any skipped cards going to the opponent’s pile. The opponent follows specific drafting criteria to determine which card they take. Skipped cards go to the player as normal.

Once all 8 cards have been taken, deal the remaining 8 cards in a circle and repeat the process. After all 16 cards are gone, the opponent scores based on the scenario card as well as for the three most common territories in their pile. The player scores their town as normal. If the player’s score is higher, they win!

Name: Deadball: 1909
Description:
Description from the publisher:

Baseball at the turn of the 20th Century: Parks were enormous, pitchers went the distance all the time, and won as much as they lost.  Hitters hit singles and doubles, but the long ball?  Not so much.  But strategy comes more in to play, including the squeeze and the hit and run to get your runners home.  In this expansion, you can try out baseball the way it used to be, with awesome handlebar mustaches and teeny-tiny gloves.  This is an alternate set of rules for Deadball, designed to reflect the statistics and mechanics of an earlier age of the National Pastime.

Name: Alien Architects
Description:
Description from the publisher:

There are exceptional monuments, buildings, and statues on Earth that have left archaeologists wondering for millennia about their origins and construction. The Great Pyramids of Egypt, the Moai of Easter Island, Stonehenge of England, the Ball of Twine of Kansas; could early civilizations of humans have designed and built these with limited technology and knowledge? Or is it possible (even probable) that we, on this planet, have been receiving help from more advanced cultures from other worlds? In Alien Architects you take on the role of an extraterrestrial who has traveled across the galaxy to compete with other aliens to build monuments on earth throughout human history. Collect or steal resources, blueprints, and technology in order to prove that you are the greatest builder in the universe. And why not have some fun with the humans while you’re here?

Name: Listening Lotto: Nursery Rhymes
Description:
In this educational children's game, players match sounds played from a cd (e.g. Clock or farm noises) to images. To play, players listen to the sounds on the CD and place tokens on the images on their game cards that match what they hear.  The sounds are all associates with common nursery rhymes.  Players win by matching the most images correctly.

Each game set includes 12 game cards with 8 photos per card, 120 game tokens, an audio CD, and directions in English.
